items.title: Outspoken pundit predicts Scottish Premiership winner, delivers Celtic verdict
items.description: Former Celtic player and current pundit Sutton has had his say on this season’s title race.

items.title: Martin O'Neill fears VAR will wreck Premiership title race as Celtic boss tells eye in the sky to butt out
items.description: The Hoops boss is in Germany for a likely Europa League swan song but it's domestic decisions that have him all steamed up

items.title: 'I will just say this' - Cvancara's message to Celtic fans ahead of Stuttgart
items.description: Tomas Cvancara is hoping he can get the goals to keep Celtic in contention in the title race with Rangers on the horizon, and perhaps even keep them in Europe.

items.title: Stuttgart vs Celtic injury news: 13 out with key trio set to miss Europa League tie as O'Neill dealt fresh blow
items.description: All the early team news ahead of Stuttgart v Celtic in the Europa League last 16 playoffs at the MHP Arena on Thursday night.

items.title: O'Neill reveals notable Celtic squad absentee, responds to 'weakened side' suggestion
items.description: Celtic manager O'Neill has provided a squad update, ahead of his side's second leg against Stuttgart in the Europa League.

items.title: Celtic manager Martin O'Neill on VAR: 'We will not be needing a referee anymore'
items.description: Martin O'Neill is furious at the 'ridiculous' red card that will now see Auston Trusty miss three crucial games for Celtic, and has criticised the use of VAR in Scotland.

items.title: VAR 'debilitating' for referees - Celtic's O'Neill
items.description: Martin O'Neill is of the view VAR is "debilitating" for officials on the pitch as he brands the Scottish FA process for appealing against decisions "worthless".

items.title: Martin O’Neill obliterates Celtic decision and brands it 'ridiculous nonsense' as ballistic boss skewers SFA

items.title: My side hold a massive lead over Celtic, but I wont be weakening my team tomorrow
items.description: Stuttgart's Hoeness has rubbished any talk of his side's play-off with Celtic being over, insisting that he will field his strongest team in the return leg.
